data: CARD SURG MIS Mitral Valve Repair or Replacement (ERAS) - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the PowerPlan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
Complete Admission or Transfer Medication Reconciliation
Discontinue CARD SURG MIS Mitral Valve Repair or Replacement (ERAS) - Pre Operative (Day of Surgery)
Refer to ERAS MIS Mitral Valve Repair or Replacement Post Operative Pathway
Remains on at all times while patient is ventilated
SBP goal: 90-120 mmHg, Hgb goal: 75 g/L or greater, SpO2 goal: 92% or greater, keep HR _____ bpm, maintain Cardiac Index greater than or equal to 2.2
SBP goal: 90-120 mmHg, Hgb goal: 80 g/L or greater, SpO2 goal: 92% or greater, keep HR _____ bpm, maintain Cardiac Index greater than or equal to 2.2
SBP goal: 90-120 mmHg, Hgb goal: 85 g/L or greater, SpO2 goal: 92% or greater, keep HR _____ bpm, maintain Cardiac Index greater than or equal to 2.2
RASS goal of -5, Unrousable, RASS goal start at -5, wean sedation to meet goal of RASS 0
Provide warming blanket for temperature below 36.5 DegC
Check intrinsic rhythm as per CSICU Pacemaker Protocol. Manage arrhythmias or pacemaker malfunction as per CSICU Emergency Situations Protocol if applicable at current site
Initiate iCOUGH or VAP protocol as per guideline, if applicable
BID, To be done at 0600 and 1600 and as needed
If patient has PAC and as per unit policy and protocol
Keep pulmonary artery catheter in situ until discussed with covering physician
On post-op day 1, once patient is drinking well (i.e. 600 mL/12 hours)
Chest Tube Number All, Suction:  -20 cm H20 suction
Post-op day 1, if removal criteria is met
If urine output less than or equal to 0.5 mL/kg/h over 4 hours, notify provider
If patient unable to void after 6 hours or if patient is experiencing lower abdominal discomfort or   distension, perform a bladder scan
If PVR greater than 400 mL, perform in-and-out catheterization and reassess in 6 hours
Site: Surgical site, Reinforce PRN, leave dressings insitu on wound until post-op day 3. Change if saturated
Progress as tolerated as per MIS Mitral Valve Repair or Replacement ERAS Clinical Pathway
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
RN to start clear fluid diet POD 0
Encourage gum chewing for 15 minutes PO TID (when awake until day of discharge)

NSAIDS contraindicated if:    
- eGFR is below 60 mL/min (below 75 mL/min in diabetic patients)    
- Platelets 50 x 10^9/L  
- Initial chest tube losses are greater than 350 mL    
- Patient has a history of asthma    
- Patient has heart failure (EF below 40%)

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
